label: A_mC34_12_ah3i2j-001
title: $\beta$-Pu Structure
comments:
Plutonium has been found in a variety of structures (Donohue, 1982): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_mP16_11_8e-001}{$\alpha$-Pu} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_mC34_12_ah3i2j-001}{$\beta$-Pu} (this structure) \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A_oF8_70_a-001}{$\gamma$-Pu} \item $\delta$-Pu is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cF4_225_a-001}{face-centered cubic $A1$ structure} \item  $\delta$'-Pu is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_tI2_139_a-001}{body-centered tetragonal $A6$ (In) structure } \item $\epsilon$-Pu is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/A_cI2_229_a-001}{body-centered cubic $A2$ structure} \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 (Zachariasen, 1963) give the coordinates of this structure in the $I2/m$ setting of space group \#12.  We used FINDSYM to transform this to the standard $C2/m$ setting.
